Literature Review: The use of structural equation modeling (SEM) has grown substantially over the past 40 years within organizational research and beyond. SEM has become a widely accepted and powerful tool for testing complex relationships between variables in organizational contexts. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the current state of SEM in organizational research, discuss best practices, and explore advanced SEM applications. We will also examine concerns and debates related to SEM, including methodological and theoretical issues.
